title: Graphs of speed and force vs time

content.description: An experiment is set up using a hanging mass to pull a cart along a horizontal track. A light string is attached from the hanging mass over a pulley to a force sensor. A second light string is attached from the force sensor to the cart. There is a motion sensor that can be used to measure different features of the motion of the cart. The pulley is ideal, and there is negligible friction between the cart and the track.
content.question: The hanging mass is released. Which of the following sets of graphs could represent output from the motion sensor and the force sensor?

choices.label: The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The first graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled v. The line begins near the top of the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right. The second graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled F. The line begins near the top of the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right.

The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The first graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled v. The line begins above the origin on the vertical axis and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate. The second graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled F. The line begins above the origin on the vertical axis and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate.

The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The first graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled v. The line begins three quarters of the way up the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right. The second graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled F. The line begins above the origin on the vertical axis and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate.

The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The first graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled v. The line begins above the origin on the vertical axis and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate. The second graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled F. The line begins three quarters of the way up the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right.

The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The first graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled v. The line begins above the origin on the vertical axis and curves upward and to the right at an increasing rate. The second graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled F. The line begins above the origin on the vertical axis and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate.

content.answer: The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The first graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled v. The line begins above the origin on the vertical axis and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate. The second graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and the vertical axis labeled F. The line begins three quarters of the way up the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
